Name: Mapped_To_Mitochondria_Rate
Definition: The proportion of reads mapping to the mitochondrial genome.

Name: Non_Redundant_Fraction
Definition: Number of distinct uniquely mapping reads (i.e. after removing duplicates) / Total number of reads.

Name: PBC_1
Definition: The PCRbottleneckCoefficient_1 is calculated as the number of positions in genome with exactly 1 read mapped uniquely compared to the number of positions with at least 1 read.

Name: PBC_2
Definition: The PCRbottleneckCoefficient_2 is a secondary measure of bottlenecking. It is calculated as the number of positions in genome with exactly 1 read mapped uniquely compared to the number of positions with exactly 2 reads mapping uniquely.

Name: Proper_Pair_Rate
Definition: The proportion of paired reads that are aligned in opposite directions and within a reasonable distance of each other on the same reference sequence/chromosome.

Name: TSSE
Definition: The TSS enrichment calculation is a signal to noise calculation. The reads around a reference set of TSSs are collected to form an aggregate distribution of reads centered on the TSSs and extending to 1000 bp in either direction (for a total of 2000bp). This distribution is then normalized by taking the average read depth in the 100 bps at each of the end flanks of the distribution (for a total of 200bp of averaged data) and calculating a fold change at each position over that average read depth.

Name: blacklist
Definition: ChIPseq will often show the presence of common artifacts, such as ultra-high signal regions. Such regions can confound peak calling, fragment length estimation and QC metrics. ENCODE Data Analysis Center (DAC) blacklisted regions were created as a reference to help deal with these regions.

Name: peak_calling
Definition: Peak caling is the process of scanning the genome to identify regions with enriched read signal (ideally compared to a control sample) using a count based statistic.

Name: Percent_Duplicated
Definition: Duplicates reflect reads mapping to exact shared location on the genome. High duplication rates in ChIP-seq are often associated with low complexity libraries but should be assessed in context of total read numbers and antibody efficiency/specificity.

Name: Percent_Multimapping
Definition: Multimapping reads are reads who can be assigned to more than one location with equal certainty. These reads are often associated with repeat regions of genome and high multimapping rates may reflect lower signal to noise for ChIP and higher backgrounds. It should be noted that some ChIPs are for factors or epigenetic marks associated to repeat DNA and so there high multimapping rates should be expected

Name: Percent_Reads_in_Blacklist
Definition: The percentage of reads that overlap with called blacklisted regions (see 'blacklist' in glossary below for information on peak calling).

Name: Percent_Reads_in_Peaks
Definition: The percentage of reads that overlap with called peak regions (see 'peak_calling' in glossary below for information on peak calling).

Name: Predicted_Fragment_Length
Definition: In single-end sequencing typically a short strech of the actual dsDNA fragment is sequenced. Fragment length is determined by systematically shifting the reads on each strand towards each other until the minimum genome coverage is achieved.

Name: Relative_Cross_Coverage
Definition: The relative cross coverage metric is calculated by comparing the maximum cross coverage peak (at the shift size corresponding to the fragment length) to the cross coverage at a shift size corresponding to the read length, with higher scores (generally 1 or greater) indicating good enrichment.

Name: Standardized_Standard_Deviation_noBlacklist
Definition: The standardized standard deviation (SSD) score with the blacklist regions removed. SSD scores are dependent on the degree of total genome wide signal pile-up and so are sensitive to regions of high signal found with Blacklisted regions as well as genuine ChIP enrichment.

Name: Standardized_Standard_Deviation
Definition: The standardized standard deviation (SSD) score is an indication of evidence of enrichment. It is computed by looking at the standard deviation of signal pile-up along the genome normalised to the total number of reads.

Name: phred_fastq_quality_score
Definition: The quality scores (i.e. phred score) for each base (e.g. q20 and q30) reflect the likelihood that the assignment of that base is incorrect. Q = -10*log10(P), with P being the probability, so q30 means there is a probability of 0.001 (0.1%) that the base is incorrect.

Name: Assigned
Definition: mapped reads that  can be assigned.

Name: Unassigned_Ambiguity
Definition: alignments that overlap two or more features (feature-level summarization) or meta-features (meta-feature-level summarization).

Name: Unassigned_Chimera
Definition: two ends in a paired end alignment are located on different chromosomes or have unexpected orientation.

Name: Unassigned_Duplicate
Definition: alignments marked as duplicate (indicated in the FLAG field).

Name: Unassigned_FragementLength
Definition: fragment length inferred from paired end alignment does not meet the length criteria.

Name: Unassigned_Juction
Definition: alignments that contain junctions.

Name: Unassigned_MappingQuality
Definition: alignments with a mapping quality score lower than the threshold.

Name: Unassigned_MultiMapping
Definition: alignments reported for multi-mapping reads (indicated by ‘NH’ tag).

Name: Unassigned_NoFeatures
Definition: alignments that do not overlap any feature.

Name: Unassigned_Nonjuction
Definition: alignments that do not contain junctions.

Name: Unassigned_Overlapping_Length
Definition: alignments that do not overlap any feature (or metafeature) with the minimum required overlap length.

Name: Unassigned_Unmapped:
Definition: Reads that have an unexpected read type (eg. being a single end read included in a paired end dataset) and also cannot be counted with confidence (eg. due to stranded counting). Such reads are typically generated from a read trimming program.

Name: Unassigned_Secondary
Definition: alignments reported as secondary alignments (indicated in the] FLAG field).

Name: Unassigned_Singleton
Definition: read pairs that have only one end mapped.

Name: Unassigned_Unmapped
Definition: unmapped reads that cannot be assigned.

Name: bam
Definition: BAM is the compressed binary version of the Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) format, a compact and index-able representation of nucleotide sequence alignments.

Name: bigwig
Definition: The bigWig format is for display of dense, continuous data that will be displayed in a genome browser (e.g. IGV or UCSC) as a graph. Examples of this type of data include ChIP-seq and RNA-seq read signal.

Name: fastq
Definition: A text-based file containing both a sequence (e.g. nucleotide sequence) and the quality scores for that particular sequence encoded by an ASCII character.

Name: GTF
Definition: GTF (Gene Transfer Format) is an extension of GFF (General Feature Format) that is comprised of 9 tab separated columns, and links features (e.g. exons) to genomic locations. GTF extends GFF by adding a column with meta-feature information (e.g. gene/transcript identifiers).

Name: reference_fasta
Definition: A reference fasta is a collection of contigs that serves as a pre-built map of a particular oprganisms genome and allows for genomic features to be evaluated in their linear genomic context. Contigs are stretches of DNA sequence encoded as A,G,C,T,N and in this case are represented in a fasta file format containing information about that contig.

Name: ID_to_symbol_map
Definition: The mapping of a gene to alternative IDs, symbols, and functional annoation is contained in the Bioconductor OrgDb packages.

Name: BAD_CYCLES
Definition: The number of instrument cycles in which 80% or more of base calls were no-calls.

Name: CATEGORY
Definition: One of either UNPAIRED (for a fragment run), FIRST_OF_PAIR when metrics are for only the first read in a paired run, SECOND_OF_PAIR when the metrics are for only the second read in a paired run or PAIR when the metrics are aggregated for both first and second reads in a pair.

Name: MEAN_READ_LENGTH
Definition: The mean read length of the set of reads examined. When looking at the data for a single lane with equal length reads this number is just the read length. When looking at data for merged lanes with differing read lengths this is the mean read length of all reads.

Name: PCT_ADAPTER
Definition: The fraction of PF reads that are unaligned and match to a known adapter sequence right from the start of the read.

Name: PCT_CHIMERAS
Definition: The fraction of reads that map outside of a maximum insert size (usually 100kb) or that have the two ends mapping to different chromosomes.

Name: PCT_PF_READS_ALIGNED
Definition: The percentage of PF reads that aligned to the reference sequence. PF_READS_ALIGNED / PF_READS

Name: PCT_PF_READS_IMPROPER_PAIRS
Definition: The fraction of (primary) reads that are *not* "properly" aligned in pairs (as per SAM flag 0x2). PF_READS_IMPROPER_PAIRS / PF_READS_ALIGNED

Name: PCT_PF_READS
Definition: The fraction of reads that are PF (PF_READS / TOTAL_READS)

Name: PCT_READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS
Definition: The fraction of reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference. READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS / PF_READS_ALIGNED

Name: PF_ALIGNED_BASES
Definition: The total number of aligned bases, in all mapped PF reads, that are aligned to the reference sequence.

Name: PF_HQ_ALIGNED_BASES
Definition: The number of bases aligned to the reference sequence in reads that were mapped at high quality. Will usually approximate PF_HQ_ALIGNED_READS * READ_LENGTH but may differ when either mixed read lengths are present or many reads are aligned with gaps.

Name: PF_HQ_ALIGNED_Q20_BASES
Definition: The subset of PF_HQ_ALIGNED_BASES where the base call quality was Q20 or higher.

Name: PF_HQ_ALIGNED_READS
Definition: The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence with a mapping quality of Q20 or higher signifying that the aligner estimates a 1/100 (or smaller) chance that the alignment is wrong.

Name: PF_HQ_ERROR_RATE
Definition: The fraction of bases that mismatch the reference in PF HQ aligned reads.

Name: PF_HQ_MEDIAN_MISMATCHES
Definition: The median number of mismatches versus the reference sequence in reads that were aligned to the reference at high quality (i.e. PF_HQ_ALIGNED READS).

Name: PF_INDEL_RATE
Definition: The number of insertion and deletion events per 100 aligned bases. Uses the number of events as the numerator, not the number of inserted or deleted bases.

Name: PF_MISMATCH_RATE
Definition: The rate of bases mismatching the reference for all bases aligned to the reference sequence.

Name: PF_NOISE_READS
Definition: The number of PF reads that are marked as noise reads. A noise read is one which is composed entirely of A bases and/or N bases. These reads are marked as they are usually artifactual and are of no use in downstream analysis.

Name: PF_READS_ALIGNED
Definition: The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence. This includes reads that aligned with low quality (i.e. their alignments are ambiguous).

Name: PF_READS_IMPROPER_PAIRS
Definition: The number of (primary) aligned reads that are **not** "properly" aligned in pairs (as per SAM flag 0x2).

Name: PF_READS
Definition: The number of PF reads where PF is defined as passing Illumina's filter.

Name: READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS
Definition: The number of aligned reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference.

Name: STRAND_BALANCE
Definition: The number of PF reads aligned to the positive strand of the genome divided by the number of PF reads aligned to the genome.

Name: TOTAL_READS
Definition: The total number of reads including all PF and non-PF reads. When CATEGORY equals PAIR this value will be 2x the number of clusters.

Name: CODING_BASES
Definition: Number of bases in primary alignments that align to a non-UTR coding base for some gene, and not ribosomal sequence.

Name: CORRECT_STRAND_READS
Definition: Number of aligned reads that are mapped to the correct strand. 0 if library is not strand-specific.

Name: IGNORED_READS
Definition: Number of primary alignments that are mapped to a sequence specified on command-line as IGNORED_SEQUENCE. These are not counted in PF_ALIGNED_BASES, CORRECT_STRAND_READS, INCORRECT_STRAND_READS, or any of the base-counting metrics. These reads are counted in PF_BASES.

Name: INCORRECT_STRAND_READS
Definition: Number of aligned reads that are mapped to the incorrect strand. 0 if library is not strand-specific.

Name: INTERGENIC_BASES
Definition: Number of bases in primary alignments that do not align to any gene.

Name: INTRONIC_BASES
Definition: Number of bases in primary alignments that align to an intronic base for some gene, and not a coding or UTR base.

Name: MEDIAN_3PRIME_BIAS
Definition: The median 3 prime bias of the 1000 most highly expressed transcripts, where 3 prime bias is calculated per transcript as: mean coverage of the 3 prime-most 100 bases divided by the mean coverage of the whole transcript.

Name: MEDIAN_5PRIME_BIAS
Definition: The median 5 prime bias of the 1000 most highly expressed transcripts. The 5 prime bias is calculated per transcript as: mean coverage of the 5 prime-most 100 bases divided by the mean coverage of the whole transcript.

Name: MEDIAN_5PRIME_TO_3PRIME_BIAS
Definition: The ratio of coverage at the 5 prime end to the 3 prime end based on the 1000 most highly expressed transcripts.

Name: MEDIAN_CV_COVERAGE
Definition: The median coefficient of variation (CV) or stdev/mean for coverage values of the 1000 most highly expressed transcripts. Ideal value = 0.

Name: NUM_R1_TRANSCRIPT_STRAND_READS
Definition: The number of reads that support the model where R1 is on the strand of transcription and R2 is on the opposite strand.

Name: NUM_R2_TRANSCRIPT_STRAND_READS
Definition: The fraction of reads that support the model where R2 is on the strand of transcription and R1 is on the opposite strand.

Name: NUM_UNEXPLAINED_READS
Definition: The fraction of reads for which the transcription strand model could not be inferred.

Name: PCT_CODING_BASES
Definition: Fraction of PF_ALIGNED_BASES that mapped to protein coding regions of genes, CODING_BASES/PF_ALIGNED_BASES

Name: PCT_CORRECT_STRAND_READS
Definition: Fraction of reads corresponding to mRNA transcripts which map to the correct strand of a reference genome = CORRECT_STRAND_READS/(CORRECT_STRAND_READS + INCORRECT_STRAND_READS). 0 if library is not strand-specific.

Name: PCT_INTERGENIC_BASES
Definition: Fraction of PF_ALIGNED_BASES that mapped to intergenic regions of genomic DNA, INTERGENIC_BASES/PF_ALIGNED_BASES

Name: PCT_INTRONIC_BASES
Definition: Fraction of PF_ALIGNED_BASES that correspond to gene introns, INTRONIC_BASES/PF_ALIGNED_BASES

Name: PCT_MRNA_BASES
Definition: Sum of bases mapped to regions corresponding to UTRs and coding regions of mRNA transcripts, PCT_UTR_BASES + PCT_CODING_BASES

Name: PCT_R1_TRANSCRIPT_STRAND_READS
Definition: The fraction of reads that support the model where R1 is on the strand of transcription and R2 is on the opposite strand. For unpaired reads, it is the fraction of reads that are on the transcription strand (out of all the reads).

Name: PCT_R2_TRANSCRIPT_STRAND_READS
Definition: The fraction of reads that support the model where R2 is on the strand of transcription and R1 is on the opposite strand. For unpaired reads, it is the fraction of reads that are on opposite strand than that of the the transcription strand (out of all the reads).

Name: PCT_RIBOSOMAL_BASES
Definition: Fraction of PF_ALIGNED_BASES that mapped to regions encoding ribosomal RNA, RIBOSOMAL_BASES/PF_ALIGNED_BASES

Name: PCT_USABLE_BASES
Definition: The fraction of bases mapping to mRNA divided by the total number of PF bases, (CODING_BASES + UTR_BASES)/PF_BASES.

Name: PCT_UTR_BASES
Definition: Fraction of PF_ALIGNED_BASES that mapped to untranslated regions (UTR) of genes, UTR_BASES/PF_ALIGNED_BASES

Name: PF_ALIGNED_BASES
Definition: The total number of aligned PF bases. Non-primary alignments are not counted. Bases in aligned reads that do not correspond to reference (e.g. soft clips, insertions) are not counted.

Name: PF_BASES
Definition: The total number of PF bases including non-aligned reads.

Name: RIBOSOMAL_BASES
Definition: Number of bases in primary alignments that align to ribosomal sequence.

Name: UTR_BASES
Definition: Number of bases in primary alignments that align to a UTR base for some gene, and not a coding base.

Name: Gene_ExonCounts
Definition: The total number of reads that overlap with exons for a given gene.

Name: Genebody_Counts
Definition: The total number of reads that overlap with any part of a transcript for given gene. This will start at the first transcription start site of any gene isoform and end at the last transcription end site.

Name: Transcripts_Per_Million
Definition: The number of reads for a given gene is divided by the length of each gene in kilobases (RPK - reads per kilobase), and this number is then divided by the 'per million' scaling factor, which is the sum of all the RPK valeus for a sample divided by 1,000,000.
